mods.abstract: A Runaway in Jail, Was committed to the Jail of the Parish of St. Landry, on the 4th October instant, a negro man calling himself Charles, and saying he belongs to a certain William Wallace, a horse drover residing in the State of Missouri, from whom he runaway on the 24th of September last, when in New-Iberia, Parish of St. Martin, Louisiana. Charles is 5 feet 5 inches high, of a griff colour, about 21 years of age, spare made, speaks english only, and has a scar near the corner of the right eye. The owner is requested to come forward, prove property, pay charges and take him away, otherwise he will be transferred to the General State Depot at Baton-Rouge, at the expiration of sixty days. CHS. THOMPSON, Jailor. Opelousas 10th October 1857. 45
